intro: Cestrum papyraceum, commonly known as the paperleaf jessamine, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its delicate, papery leaves that give it its common name, and it produces fragrant, tubular flowers in shades of yellow to white. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in warm climates. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Cestrum papyraceum is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and moths.
